qas.question: At what pub did Thomas Paine write The Rights of Man?
In what district of London is The Angel located?
What writer mentioned The Angel pub in his writings?
What is the present status of the Angel pub?
Prior to becoming a pub, what did the Angel serve as?

context: <a0_0>The Angel<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Islington<a1_0/> was formerly <a4_0>a coaching inn<a4_0/>, the first on the route northwards out of London, where Thomas Paine is believed to have written much of The Rights of Man. It was mentioned by <a2_0>Charles Dickens<a2_0/>, became a Lyons Corner House, and is now <a3_0>a Co-operative Bank<a3_0/>.
